title: Fed’s Bullard Says Central Bank Monetary Policy Is in ‘Good Place’
sub_head: The St. Louis Fed chief noted the job-market recovery has been much stronger than expected
body:
Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis leader James Bullard said Wednesday that while he expects the U.S. economy to recover robustly this year, it isn’t time for the Federal Reserve to think about pulling back on support for the economy.
“We’re in a good place with monetary policy,” Mr. Bullard said after a virtual presentation to a group of financial professionals. He also told reporters the Fed shouldn’t contemplate pulling back on stimulus, and that a debate over doing so would need to be initiated by top Fed leaders.
